column4: hi there.  what is the terminal command equivalent to reloading/refreshing the nautilus desktop? in other words, when i focus on a nautilus window, what happens internally when F5 is pressed?

Well you'd have to look at the source code to know that.  It probably makes some calls similar to ls (I'm not sure if it actually makes kernel calls or if it calls ls or if there is something that both ls and nautilus F5 use)
What is the ultimate goal here?
well, i'm making a bash script that does many things, one of which uses sed to search within a .desktop file to change the icon.  it works all well, but the icon doesn't refresh until i use f5
Ahhh, so you wanna force that right away...
yeah, the real problem is that there is no API for nautilus (that I know of)

yea, it would complete my script :-)  i tried a couple of methods, on was xrefresh (doesn't seem to work at all) the other used gconftool-2 to toggle the showing of the nautilus desktop (which crashed nautius).  so yea, i'll need to find another way to do this.  i posted in nautilus' IRC channel, but no reply yet
there is an API for C and python!  http://projects.gnome.org/nautilus-python/
I suggest you switch your script to python (probably will make the whole thing easier)
ahh, well i don't know if i have the time to learn python, i'm just barely starting to learn bash..but thanks for pointing me in the right direction
sending the F5 signal is a good idea
yes, i guess now the only problem is somehow bringing focus to nautilus
got it!! wmctrl -k on xsendkeycode 71 1 xsendkeycode 71 0  (focus the desktop, press F5, release F5) thanks again for your input, i could not have done it without you
haha, I didn't do anything!  good job :)
